page.title: 18PLACE NAMES,ALLET/CALLESTICK
page.content: {Callestick}:Cornish,fox-grove or fox- field. There are still many foxes in this lightly wooded area. {Ventongimps}:(Higher & Lower V. farms) Cornish,spring(venton)in a flat place. {Chy}:Cornish,house.The old mine engine house at Chyverton near Callestick is marked "Chy" on O.S. maps. {Chybucca} :Cornish, haunted house. {Choon} :Cornish, house on downs. {Chynhale} :Cornish, house on a moor. {Tresawsen}:Cornish, Englishmen's home- stead (tre). {Fourburrow}:after a group of 4 ancient barrows nearby. {Creegmeor}:Cornish,great barrow. There are many tumuli in this area. {Allet}:said by local people to come from "all let",from the time when most of the land in this area was leased from Lord Falmouth's estate.
